parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions "PSD" (Partidul Social Democrat), a parliamentary candidate party.  This directly refers to a political party participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The targeting data shows a broad geographical reach across multiple cities and counties in Romania. This satisfies Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The post's message ("PSD te-a vrut tăcut... A venit vremea schimbării! NOI suntem VOCEA! NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!") directly aims to influence voters' choices in the upcoming elections. It criticizes the PSD and encourages a change, implicitly advocating for a different party or candidate. This clearly fulfills Article 36 (7) - c, having an electoral objective and addressing the public.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post is presented by "Vocea - Botosani," a news and media website, the content is not objective journalism. It's overtly partisan, criticizing the PSD and promoting an alternative without presenting balanced information or factual evidence. It lacks the neutrality expected from journalistic reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post goes beyond expressing a personal opinion; it's a clear call to action, urging voters to choose against the PSD and implicitly for another option.  The language used is not neutral and aims to sway public opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1000778341856558</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by "Vocea - Botosani," clearly constitutes electoral propaganda. It directly mentions the PSD, a parliamentary candidate party, and uses strong, persuasive language to encourage voters to reject them. The targeting data shows a wide geographical reach, indicating an intention to influence a large number of voters. The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting, instead functioning as a partisan advertisement.  The timing of the post, considering the provided end date, needs to be verified against the official end date of the electoral campaign to determine if it violates the post-election propaganda ban.  However, based on the content alone, it meets the criteria for electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Partidul Social Democrat (PSD)</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea - Botosani</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Vocea - Botosani, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1000778341856558) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu conținut electoral care promovează schimbarea față de PSD printr-un mesaj direct și persuasiv ("PSD te-a vrut tăcut... A venit vremea schimbării! NOI suntem VOCEA! NOI decidem pe 1 decembrie!"), având ca efect electoral influențarea negativă a voturilor pentru PSD. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON, a atins o audiență estimată între 100.000 și 500.000 de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library, și a vizat mai multe localități din județele Botoșani, Iași și Suceava.  Contactul este office@voceabotosani.ro și +40759112233.  Această postare, deși publicată de un site de știri, depășește limitele jurnalismului obiectiv, constituind propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei electorale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
